As I understand it, knowing the thoughts of the assembly, this body is false and deceptive, just like an empty village;
The six sense bases are like a village, where the bandits of afflictions dwell. Each abides in its own domain, unaware of the others.
The eye faculty receives forms;
The ear discriminates sounds;
The nose smells various fragrances;
The tongue delights in flavors;
The body faculty greedily experiences various tactile sensations;
The mind faculty discriminates all phenomena.
The six sense faculties each rely on their own objects, not engaging in the objects of others.
The mind is like an illusion, racing through the six sense objects, always conceptualizing and
discriminating phenomena;
It is like people in the world running in an empty village, harmed by the six thieves, yet foolishly not knowing how to avoid them.
The objects of the six sense faculties each know their own domain,
Following after forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile sensations, and mental objects.
Like a bird caught in a net, the mind is always dwelling in the sense faculties,
Following after the various sense objects, without any temporary abandonment.
It cannot be nurtured, there is no dispute, and there is no true master,
Arising from various causes and conditions, it exists in combination, without any solid reality,
Arising from false imagination.
Earth, water, fire, and wind, gathering and forming, increase and decrease with the seasons,

The four great snakes have natures that are each different - two are above and two are below,
The directions are also two - in this way, the great snakes all perish without remainder.
The two snakes of earth and water have natures that sink down;

Following karma and receiving retribution, in the realms of humans, gods, and other destinies, following the karma that is created,

When the elements of water, fire, and wind disperse and perish, the impurities inside and out overflow;

Thus, these great elements, each is not real, originally unborn,
